Ali & Ava

Last updated on November 15, 2022

I went to see this film on May 26, 2022, thinking it would be a bit of a boring rom com. I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong, but I‚Äôm chalking it up to my lack of exposure to art house cinema during the pandemic. I‚Äôve seen it in the theatre three times so far, and it might be my favorite film of the year.

The story of Ali and Ava lingers like a Zadie Smith novel. It‚Äôs kind, newly sincere, and quiet. There‚Äôs something very refreshing about seeing a story of love play out across ethnic and cultural differences without the whole thing falling into the type of racial tensions particular to the context of the United States. It‚Äôs an unromcom.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
